intro: Ternstroemia brevistyla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ternstroemia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Theaceae, which includes camellias and other ornamental shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist forest environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists.
